p: In studies on the reduction of the development of phytopathogens, essential oils of different chemical composition were used. Table 1 and Table 2 present the main types of terpenes found in the tested oils and the details of the chemical composition. The chromatograms of the used essential oils are presented in Figure A1, Figure A2, Figure A3 and Figure A4. The rosemary and geranium oils contained mainly monoterpenoid (over 96% and over 88%, respectively), whereas lemon oil contained mainly monoterpenes (less than 86%) and only 13.8% monoterpenoids. The most varied in terms of chemical composition turned out to be rosemary oil, which contained both monoterpenoids (52.8%) and monoterpenes (35.3%) as well as sesquiterpenes (11.5%).
